awd_abstract_narration: Dr. Cudworth, at the Yerkes Observatory of the University of                    Chicago, is conducting research on star clusters which primarily                involves observational investigations of proper motions and                     photometric studies of the members of globular and open clusters.                                                                                               Star clusters are important for testing theories of stellar                     evolution, galactic evolution, and stellar dynamics.  Clusters                  also contribute to the luminosity calibration for a variety of                  types of stars, as well as the distance scale of the Galaxy and                 the Universe.  In all of these areas a criterion for membership                 of stars in the cluster is needed which is independent of                       theories of stellar evolution.  Measurements of proper motions                  are used to derive cluster membership, study the internal                       dynamics of the clusters, and derive the cluster space                          velocities.  Dr. Cudworth has a reputation for careful and                      accurate contributions in this area of fundamental astronomy.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
